Item(by='rupi', descendants=176, kids=[25317864, 25320373, 25320444, 25319722, 25316126, 25320407, 25319164, 25320123, 25317969, 25319614, 25318902, 25315915, 25320550, 25320153, 25319897, 25317915, 25318014, 25317776, 25318325, 25319475, 25319764, 25320378, 25317757, 25318228, 25318296, 25320290, 25317951, 25317706, 25319488, 25318217, 25318219, 25319917, 25319397, 25319332, 25319900, 25318354, 25319687, 25318150, 25319337, 25318725, 25318639, 25320003, 25317853, 25318356, 25318480, 25319147, 25317854, 25319384, 25313766, 25319061, 25318185, 25317885, 25318688, 25314144, 25319012, 25318821, 25318732, 25318724, 25319449, 25312897, 25319680, 25318527, 25317723, 25317884, 25320414, 25314748, 25320395, 25317743, 25319425, 25318498, 25319361, 25317851, 25318981, 25317891, 25317970, 25318546, 25318951, 25317792, 25318440, 25318431, 25319302, 25318478, 25318309, 25319631, 25317899, 25319456], score=152, time=1607154293, title='Ask HN: Learning about Philosophy', item_type='story', url=None, parent=None, text='Are there any books that are considered a must for someone new to the field of philosophy?<p>I understand it is a vague question but it is a topic I have recently become interested in because of digging deeper into mental models. Mental models address a lot of &#x27;practical&#x27; situations but I am realizing that they fall short when it comes to bigger questions of life.<p>What path did you follow to develop a personal philosophy?')
